channel.title: BBC News - Europe

item.title: Aukus pact: France and US seek to mend rift
item.description: The deal caused outrage in France, which lost a contract to build submarines for Australia.

item.title: German cashier shooting linked to Covid-19 conspiracies
item.description: A man suspected of killing a cashier is linked to conspiracy theorists and far-right politics.

item.title: Ukraine leader's aide survives assassination attempt
item.description: President Zelensky vows a strong response after his aide's car is struck by a volley of bullets.

item.title: La Palma volcano lava engulfs homes and swimming pools
item.description: Molten rock from the erupting Cumbre Vieja volcano is destroying hundreds of buildings.

item.title: Barcelona: The toxic battle ripping apart a European giant
item.description: The tense battle between Barcelona president Joan Laporta and manager Ronald Koeman is tearing the club apart, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Russia behind Litvinenko murder, rules European rights court
item.description: The former Russian spy, who became a British citizen, was poisoned in London with polonium in 2006.

item.title: Russian students grieve after deadly Perm university attack
item.description: The Russian city of Perm mourns after a gunman killed six people, including teenagers.

item.title: German elections 2021: 'Bazooka man' Olaf Scholz bidding for chancellor
item.description: The centre-left finance minister has led the polls in the run-up to the vote to succeed Angela Merkel.

item.title: German elections: Businesses face future without Merkel
item.description: Many companies in Germany are focused on short-term survival in the hope of medium-term revival.

item.title: John Challis: Why Serbians have soft spot for late Only Fools actor
item.description: Only Fools and Horses is hugely popular in Serbia, where tributes have been paid to John Challis.

item.title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
item.description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

item.title: Evergrande sparks economy fears worldwide
item.description: The world's most indebted real estate developer is in crisis, spooking global investors.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Aukus pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: BBC reporter on the evacuation of La Palma residents
item.description: The BBC reports on the evacuation of hundreds of homes in the path of an erupting volcano on La Palma.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Russia election: Footage is alleged to show ballot stuffing
item.description: Russia's interior ministry told reporters it had not registered any "significant violations".

item.title: Volcano on Canary Island La Palma erupts, spewing ash and lava into national park
item.description: Video shows the volcano, on La Palma, spewing ash and lava in its first major eruption since 1971.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.
